title: Waistcoat, Uncut, ca. 1750–1800
medium:
Medium: linen, silk
Technique: embroidery (chain stitch)
description: Two fronts and two pocket flaps for man's waistcoat, or cream colored linen, plain cloth, embroidered in colored silks in chain stitch. Delicate vine design ascends front. Flower sprays under and on pockets. Colors: red, pink, green, violet, blue, and yellow. Bottom of some cloth, with worked edges. Buttonholes outlined in color, but not cut.

tombstone.epitaph:
Waistcoat, Uncut, ca. 1750–1800.
ca. 1750–1800. Medium: linen, silk
Technique: embroidery (chain stitch). Gift of Mrs. Max Farrand. 1953-143-9-a/d.
